Class Dog

java.lang.Object
Dog
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, PersonalityStrategy
public class Dog extends Object implements PersonalityStrategy, Serializable
The Dog class implements the PersonalityStrategy interface and supports object serialization by implementing Serializable.

This class adjusts the behavior of a pet based on its health. Specifically:

  • If the health level is below 70, the preferred action is set to Action.FEED.
  • Otherwise, the preferred action is set to Action.PLAY.

Usage example:

 
 Dog dog = new Dog();
 Pet pet = new Pet();
 dog.adjustBehavior(pet);
See Also:
  • PersonalityStrategy

  • Method Details

    • adjustBehavior

      public void adjustBehavior(Pet pet)
      Adjusts the behavior of the given pet based on its health level.

      This method sets the preferred action of the pet to Action.FEED if its health level is below 70. Otherwise, the preferred action is set to Action.PLAY.

      Specified by:
      adjustBehavior in interface PersonalityStrategy
      Parameters:
      pet - the pet whose behavior is being adjusted
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if pet is null
